TITLE: Idaho murders timeline: What we know about the slayings of four students
SUMMARY: This is what is known so far about the grisly murders of four University of Idaho students, who were found stabbed to death in an off-campus home Nov. 13, according to police.

TITLE: Idaho murders timeline: What we know about the slayings of four students
SUMMARY: This is what is known so far about the grisly murders of four University of Idaho students, who were found stabbed to death in an off-campus home Nov. 13, according to police.

TITLE: Paul Pelosi attacker to appear in court for alleged hammer assault
SUMMARY: David DePape will appear in court for a hearing on August 2nd. He was indicted on November 9th by a federal grand jury after allegedly violently attacking the House speaker's husband.

TITLE: HEROES OF KABUL: Lance Cpl. Dylan Merola wanted to help Afghans escape the Taliban. That was his final mission
SUMMARY: The Gold Star family of Lance Cpl. Dylan Merola, who was killed in the August 2021 suicide bombing at the Kabul airport, reflected on the fallen Marine's childhood.

TITLE: HEROES OF KABUL: Staff Sgt. Darin Taylor Hoover handed out ammo to his men despite facing mortal injuries
SUMMARY: Staff Sgt. Taylor Hoover spent his final moments handing out ammo to his fellow Marines despite facing mortal injuries from the suicide attack on the Kabul airport.

TITLE: HEROES OF KABUL: ‘All good here,’ Staff Sgt. Ryan Knauss wrote in last message to mom
SUMMARY: Staff Sgt. Ryan Knauss was among the 13 American service members killed by a suicide bomber on Aug. 26, 2021, during the U.S. military withdrawal from Afghanistan.

TITLE: HEROES OF KABUL: Lance Cpl. Jared Schmitz would sacrifice his life again if it meant saving his fellow Marines
SUMMARY: The father and stepmother on the life of 20-year-old U.S. Marine Lance Cpl. Jared Schmitz, who was killed in the August 2021 suicide bombing at the Kabul airport.

TITLE: 9/11 victim's son hunted for details about his dad's death. It led to abuse and drugs – then redemption
SUMMARY: Matthew Bocchi became fixated on his dad's death after hearing he jumped from the north tower on Sept. 11. It led to abuse and drug addiction, then redemption.
